1. Reduce single-use plastic: People can reduce the amount of single-use plastic by using alternatives such as reusable bags, bottles, containers, and straws.

2. Proper waste disposal: Proper waste disposal is critical to reducing plastic pollution. People should dispose of plastic items properly in designated recycling bins.

3. Education: Education can play a key role in raising awareness about plastic pollution and its impact on the environment. Community education campaigns can be helpful.

4. Government regulation: Governments can impose strict laws on the use of single-use plastics or impose taxes on non-biodegradable plastics.

5. Encourage reuse: Manufacturers can encourage the reuse and recycling of plastic by designing their products with recycle-friendly materials.

6. Innovative technologies: Researchers and innovators can come up with new technologies to combat the negative impacts of plastic pollution.

7. Participate in beach and park cleanups: Efforts by the public to participate in beach and park cleanups can help reduce plastic pollution by removing existing waste from the environment.
